definition: abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: The hammer and sickle was flying over the roof.
sentences.chinese: 镰刀斧头旗在屋顶上下空飘扬。

sentences.english: The national flags of the two countries were flying at the square in front of the Presidential Palace which was built in the 16th century.
sentences.chinese: 始建于16世纪的总统府广场上飘扬着中阿两国国旗。

sentences.english: And they keep the national flag of China flying in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 他们让祖国国旗保持在风中高高飘扬。

sentences.english: Use this to simulate randomly changing forces on the cloth, such as wind turbulences waving a flag.
sentences.chinese: 用这个来模拟随机大小的力，如随风飘扬的旗帜。

sentences.english: Most products are shipped across the world to feed their needs.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，大部分产品都是飘扬过海从海外运送过来的。

sentences.english: The red flag is flying high in the Chinese Embassy in Sudan.
sentences.chinese: 中国驻苏丹大使馆，五星红旗高高飘扬。

sentences.english: Joy is the flag that is flown from the castle of the heart.
sentences.chinese: 喜乐如旗正飘扬从我心中的城堡。

sentences.english: Flags are waving in the air.
The national flags of the two countries flew high at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 机场上空中乌两国国旗高高飘扬。

sentences.english: The breeze flaunted in succession like a story with beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 纷纷飘扬的风絮如同一个个美丽的故事。

sentences.english: Red flag, fluttering, and future, the sacred assembly.
sentences.chinese: 鲜红旗帜，高高飘扬，继往开来，神圣集结。

sentences.english: She stood in the wind with her hair flying.
sentences.chinese: 她站在风中，头发随风飘扬着。

sentences.english: It must fly in the stadium for the entre duration of the Games.
sentences.chinese: 在整个奥运会比赛期间它必须一直体育场内飘扬。

sentences.english: Our flag still waves proudly from the walls.
sentences.chinese: 我们的旗帜仍然骄傲地飘扬在各个墙头上。

sentences.english: The animals have fled.Ash blows on the wind.
sentences.chinese: 动物们已逃得无影无踪，只剩下灰烬在风中飘扬。

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
